title: How to Catch & Use Red Snappers in Stardew Valley: Gameplay Guide

steps.title: Wait until rainy days in Summer or Fall.
steps.content: Wait until rainy days in Summer or Fall. Red Snappers can be caught in the Spring or Fall during rainy days. You can also catch Red Snappers during the Winter if you use a Rain Totem. There are a few exceptions to this, however, though they require game progression or gold: [1] X Research source If you have access to Qi's Walnut Room, you can buy Magic Bait that allows you to catch any fish regardless of the weather, time, or season. You can purchase Magic Bait for 5 Qi Gems, as well as the recipe for Magic Bait for 20 Qi Gems. [2] X Research source Red Snappers can randomly (and rarely) be found in Garbage Cans during Summer, Fall and Winter. You can also sometimes find Red Snappers for sale in the Traveling Cart for 100 to 1,000 gold.

steps.title: Go to the Beach between the hours of 6am and 7pm.
steps.content: Go to the Beach between the hours of 6am and 7pm. Red Snappers can also be found on the Beach Farm, if you selected that farm layout.

steps.title: Go fishing.
steps.content: Go fishing. Red Snappers are a relatively common fish, so you shouldn't have too much trouble catching one. The hardest part of catching a Red Snapper is waiting for a rainy day. Red Snappers have the Mixed behavior during the fishing mini-game, which is the standard movement pattern. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Three recipes can be made with Red Snapper.
steps.content: Three recipes can be made with Red Snapper. However, these recipes do not require Red Snapper specifically, so you can technically use any fish to make them. The recipes you can use Red Snapper in are as follows: [4] X Research source Maki Roll: 1 Fish (any), 1 Seaweed, 1 Rice Quality Fertilizer: 1 Fish (any), 2 Sap Sashimi: 1 Fish (any)

steps.title: Red Snapper is used in a Community Center Bundle.
steps.content: Red Snapper is used in a Community Center Bundle. Red Snapper is one of the fish you must submit for the Ocean Fish Community Center Bundle in the Fish Tank. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Red Snapper can be used to create clothing.
steps.content: Red Snapper can be used to create clothing. If you put a Red Snapper in the Sewing Machine, you can make a Sailor Shirt. [6] X Research source It can also be used as red dye in the Dye Pots in Emily and Haley's house.

steps.title: Red Snappers are used in two quests at the Help Wanted board.
steps.content: Red Snappers are used in two quests at the Help Wanted board. The first quest is an item delivery quest that you can find during Summer, Fall, or Winter, and to complete the quest you must deliver one Red Snapper. This will get you 150 gold and 150 friendship points with the poster. [7] X Research source Willy or Demetrius may also request one to four Red Snappers during the Summer or Fall at the Help Wanted board. You will get 50 gold per fish, and you can keep the fish after turning in the quest.

steps.title: Red Snappers can be placed in the Fish Pond, where they will reproduce.
steps.content: Red Snappers can be placed in the Fish Pond, where they will reproduce. You can initially place 3 Red Snappers in your Fish Pond, but if you complete three quests you can store up to 10. Red Snappers will reproduce every 2 days. The only item you can harvest from Red Snappers is Red Snapper Roe, which is red in color (not to be confused with Sturgeon Roe , which is black). [8] X Research source

steps.title: You can use Red Snapper as a gift.
steps.content: You can use Red Snapper as a gift. While it's not an ideal use of the fish, you can give Red Snapper as a gift to Demetrius, Elliot, Leo, Linus, Pam, Sebastian, and Willy, who will all have a neutral reaction to receiving this gift. All other villagers dislike or hate Red Snapper as a gift, and you should avoid giving it to them.
